TextView.android:text: CAUSES: Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious disease caused by the bacterium Mycobacterium tuberculosis (MTB).Although TB is spread in a similar way to a cold or the flu, it isn't as contagious. SYMPTOMS: General signs and symptoms include fever, chills, night sweats, loss of appetite, weight loss, and fatigue Significant nail clubbing may also occur TESTS FRO TUBERULOSIS: Tuberculin Skin Test (TST). TB Blood Tests. PREVENTIVE MEASURES: Avoid exposing yourself to people with active TB Get the BCG vaccination to prevent TB Schedule a TB test if you have been exposed to someone with tuberculosis EFFECTS OF TB: feeling sick or dizzy skin rashes pins and needles flu like symptoms In very few cases people may experience jaundice, which is the yellowing of skin or eyes. If this happens, stop taking your medication and tell your doctor straight away. vaccine : THE VACCINE AVAILABLE FOR TB IS BCG(bacille Calmette-Guerin) FOR MORE INFO:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuberculosis
